intro: Bradleia multilocularis, commonly known as the multilocular bradleia, is a rare and striking member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, often attracting pollinators like hummingbirds. Its foliage consists of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, Bradleia multilocularis is highly sought after by botanical enthusiasts and conservationists alike.
